description: Bahrain's Consultant of Infectious Diseases Dr. Jameela Al-Salman explained that according to the World Health Organization (WHO), the confirmed cases should be isolated, and the suspected cases are applied to the isolation until the laboratory results appear, and if the suspect is confirmed to be infected, the isolation is performed, and if the result is negative, the patient is given instructions to stay at home for 14 days.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Bahrain, the Ministry of Health urged citizens and residents who have visited Italy, South Korea, Egypt and Lebanon during the past 14 days (from March 8) to self-isolate immediately and schedule a medical examination.

description: As of March 17, All passengers arriving to Bahrain must declare to the airline and to the airport authorities if their point of departure was from any of the following countries: China, Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia, Iran, South Korea, Singapore, Iraq, Japan and Italy. All those arriving from abroad will be required to self-quarantine for 14 days.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Bahrain announced on April 5th that it is enforcing people in quarantine to wear electronic tracking bracelets that alert the monitoring station when they are 15 metres away from their phone. Violators will face legal penalties as per Public Health Law No. 34 for the year 2018, potentially being sentenced to imprisonment for a period not less than 3 months and a fine between BD1,000 (Dh9,700) and BD10,000, or either of the two penalties.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Bahrain has ordered all non-essential businesses to close from Thursday, March 26, as the COVID-19 crisis continues, adding that only hypermarkets, supermarkets, cold stores, bakeries, pharmacies, and banks can remain open.

The order requires all non-essential retail and industrial enterprises to close temporarily,  from 7 p.m. on Thursday, March 26, 2020 until 7pm on Thursday, April 9, 2020.
